sch_entrance01_boy_01:
There’re more books than I can read in a lifetime.
Boy, am I ever glad I came to this school!
sch_entrance01_girl_01:
I feel like I can grow stronger if I sign up for
battle studies!
sch_entrance01_girl_07:
You know, you can get a lot of battle tips from
Ms. Tyme’s math class too.
sch_entrance01_boy_09:
I really like language class! It doesn’t have too
much to do with Pokémon, though...
sch_entrance01_girl_02:
Occulture is such a weird magazine! It’s just full
of utter nonsense!
sch_entrance01_girl_03:
Don’t think I’ve ever seen a school where the
entrance was also the library!
sch_entrance01_boy_03:
I’m pretty good at Pokémon battles but I have
trouble studying...\c
Think you can help me prep for our next exam?
sch_entrance01_boy_04:
I’m really good at my studies, but Pokémon
battles are another story...\c
Do you think you can help me become stronger?
sch_entrance01_girl_04:
There’s a book about the Herba Mystica—I know
there is—but where could it be...?
sch_entrance01_man_01:
Hey, did you know that this school was
established 805 years ago?
sch_entrance01_boy_05: Isn’t it impressive? Everyone here is here to study!
sch_entrance01_boy_06:
Are you going for the STEM track? Or maybe
the humanities track? If you’re into Pokémon,\r
then the general studies track might be good?
sch_entrance01_man_02:
I’m from a small town called Alfornada! There’s
so many people here at the school!
sch_entrance01_girl_05:
I heard it’s easier to find where I’m going if I look
it up on the computer. Is that true?
sch_entrance01_boy_07:
These Pachirisu are helping me get books I
can’t reach!
sch_entrance01_boy_10:
There’s this girl named Penny in the STEM track.
She’s smart and really good with machines.\c
I heard she’s started coming to school again.
sch_entrance01_girl_08:
Reading out loud from your textbook gets your
ears and mouth in on the learning!
sch_entrance01_girl_09:
I joined the school because I wanted to learn
about Pokémon, but now I’m getting interested\r
in the STEM track too!
sch_entrance01_boy_11:
Bug types eat grass—that’s why they’re strong
against Grass types!
sch_entrance01_boy_12:
I asked so many questions that the teacher
learned my name on the first day!
sch_entrance01_woman_03:
So between a Super Potion and a Hyper Potion,
which one heals your Pokémon more?
sch_entrance01_woman_04:
Have you heard of Team Star? They were a big
problem around here—but that was a while ago.
sch_entrance01_man_03:
I’m telling you—I’m not a teacher, I’m a student!
I’m wearing the uniform, aren’t I?!
sch_entrance01_man_06:
Steel-type moves are super effective against
Fairy-type Pokémon... Did I get that right?
sch_entrance01_man_07:
It’s so hard to figure out the type matchups of
Pokémon with two types...
sch_entrance01_woman_02:
It’s great that night classes are available here.
I can work during the day and still learn!
sch_entrance01_woman_05:
I stay up late at night because it seems like a
waste to let the day end early...but then I regret\r
it the next morning.
sch_entrance01_woman_06:
I saw a Pokémon drop a coin. I kept the coin so
I could give it back, but the Pokémon was so tiny\r
that I haven’t been able to find it since.
sch_entrance01_boy_08:
They say there are some Pokémon that’ll evolve
if you have them walk with you for a long time.
sch_entrance01_girl_06:
The school is so mysterious at night! You meet
completely different people than during the day!\c
Did you know that outside towns, different
Pokémon come out at night too?
sch_entrance01_man_04:
It’s an honor to be able to study here at the
alma mater of a famous professor.
sch_entrance01_man_05:
This kid Arven in my class seems like he’s been
having a rough time since, like, last year. I know\r
how hard it must be for him.
